intro: Sarcocapnos enneaphylla, commonly known as the nine-leafed sarcocapnos, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and usually pink or white, blooming in early spring. Sarcocapnos enneaphylla is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
